contextId.information: This can be stated in positive form. AT: "We will kill whoever has stolen your gods" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]])
contextId.quote: Whoever has stolen your gods will not continue to live

contextId.information: The negation can be placed on the verb. Also, "shedding blood" is a euphemism for killing someone. AT: "Do not spill any blood" or "Do not kill him" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_litotes]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_euphemism]])
